com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image
Class Image

java.lang.Object
  com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.Image
Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardImage
public abstract class Image
extends Object

A 2 dimensional array of pixels. The pixels are laid out in a grid with the horizontal direction being the x dimension and the vertical direction being the y dimension.

Bands

A pixel is an array of doubles. For example, a color pixel would be an array of size 3, one double for red, one double for green, and one double for blue. A grayscale image would have a pixel which is just a single double. The different values in a pixel are referred to as bands. For example, a color image has a red band, a green band, and a blue band where a gray image has only the gray band.

Interpolation

Image values can be accessed by integer coordinates as well as double coordinates. If you access the image with double coordinates then the pixels closest to the point you desire will be interpolated to provide the resulting value.

Pixel Order

Images can also return the values as a single array packed according to some kind of pixel order. If you had a 3x3 image like so:

1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9

where each item is a pixel of (A,B,C). Then if you get an iterator with row major order (x first, then y) you will receive:

1A 1B 1C 2A 2B 2C 3A 3B 3C 4A ...

and if you get an iterator with column major order (y first, then x) you will receive:

1A 1B 1C 4A 4B 4C 7A 7B 7C 2A ...

getWidth

Returns the width of the image

Returns:
The width of the image, in pixels

getHeight

public abstract int getHeight()
Returns the height of the image

Returns:
The height of the image, in pixels

getNumBands

public abstract int getNumBands()
Returns the number of bands in the image. The number of bands tells how many values are in each pixel.

Returns:
The number of bands in the image

get

public double get(int x,
                  int y,
                  int b)
Gets the value at the given coordinates and band. For example, to get the green value of an rgb image at the pixel located at 2,7 you would access 2,7,1 (1 is the index of the green band). This method is guaranteed not to interpolate. If the x or y coordinate is less than 0 or greater than the width/height then an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the desired value
y - The y coordinate of the desired value
b - The band you wish to access
Returns:
The value represented by those coordinates
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If illegal coordinates are supplied

get

public double get(int x,
                  int y,
                  int b,
                  OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy outOfBoundsAccessStrategy)
Gets the value at the given, possibly out of bounds, coordinates and band. This method is guaranteed not to interpolate. If the x or y coordinate is less than 0 or greater than the width/height then the given OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy will determine how the value is retrieved.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the desired value
y - The y coordinate of the desired value
b - The band you wish to access
outOfBoundsAccessStrategy - The strategy to use to obtain values beyond the edge
Returns:
The value represented by those coordinates

doSet

public abstract void doSet(int x,
                           int y,
                           int b,
                           double value)

set

public void set(int x,
                int y,
                int b,
                double value)
Sets the value represented by the given coordinates and band. For example, to set the blue value of an rgb image at the pixel located at 7,2 you would access 7,2,2 (2 is the index of the blue band). If the supplied parameters are out of range than an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel to set
y - The y coordinate of the pixel to set
b - The band of the pixel to set
value - The value to set
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If the coordinates given are out of range

get

public double get(double x,
                  double y,
                  int b)
Interpolates the value at the given coordinates and band. This method will obtain the value through interpolation since the x and y coordinates are supplied as doubles.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel to get
y - The y coordinate of the pixel to get
b - The band you wish to access
Returns:
The interpolated value represented by those coordinates

get

public double get(double x,
                  double y,
                  int b,
                  Interpolator interpolator)
Interpolates the value at the given coordinates and band. This method will obtain the value by interpolating the neighbors with the given interpolator.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel to get
y - The y coordinate of the pixel to get
b - The band you wish to access
interpolator - The interpolator algorithm to use to obtain the value from the neighbors
Returns:
The interpolated value represented by those coordinates

getPixels

public abstract Iterable<Double> getPixels(Image.PixelOrder pixelOrder)
Returns an iterable of the pixels in the given row order. See the comments at the class level for more details on the pixel order. The pixel bands will be interleaved so for each pixel you will get each band and then you will get the next pixel. For example, in an RGB image the values will be R1B1G1R2B2...

Parameters:
rowOrder - The pixel order of the resulting iterator
Returns:
An iterable of band-interleaved pixel values in the supplied order

getPixels

public Iterable<Double> getPixels()
Returns an iterable of pixels in the RowMajor pixel order.

Returns:
An iterable of band-interleaved pixel values in row-major order

getPixelWriter

public abstract Sinkerator<Double> getPixelWriter(Image.PixelOrder pixelOrder)
Returns a iteratee which will allow you to write the pixel values out. Each call to putNext will replace the pixel value poitned at with the given value and move on to the next value.

Returns:
An iteratee of band-interleaved pixels that writes into the pixel values

getPixelWriter

public Sinkerator<Double> getPixelWriter()
Returns a iteratee of pixels in RowMajor pixel order.

Returns:
An iteratee of band-interleaved pixels in row-major order.
